thread.title: Cold facts: After being up 3-1, Stars lose division game to Avalanche 6-3
thread.title_full: Cold facts: After being up 3-1, Stars lose division game to Avalanche 6-3 | Dallas Morning News

author: Mike Heika
title: Cold facts: After being up 3-1, Stars lose division game to Avalanche 6-3
text:
Click here to view the box score .
Colorado 6, Stars 3 Three Stars 1. Gabriel Landeskog, Colorado - Two goals, two assists
2. Cody Eakin, Stars - two goals
3. Nathan MacKinnon, Colorado - Goal and two assists
Save of the Game Colorado goalie Semyon Varlamov made a great sweeping glove deflection of a hard Tyler Seguin one-timer with the score tied 3-3 early in the third period.
Discuss Are you OK with Jamie Oleksiak and Patrik Nemeth sitting or would you like to see a rotation on the third defensive pair?
What does it mean? The Stars went 0-3-2 against the Avalanche en route to an 8-14-7 record against the Central Division last season, so this one really hurts.
THE GOALS Stars : Jason Demers made a smart, smooth, patient transition on an odd-man rush and found Mattias Janmark with a chip pass streaking down the middle of the slot. Janmark slipped a backhand under Semyon Varlamov 20 seconds into the first period. Stars 1, Colorado 0 .
Colorado : On a broken play at the blueline, Colorado's Alex Tanguay stepped up and slipped a quick pass to Nathan MacKinnon, who flipped a shot past Antti Niemi at the 9:06 mark of the first period. Stars 1, Colorado 1 .
Stars : After a nice shift from the top line, Cody Eakin shoveled in a rebound at the 10:21 mark of the first period. Jamie Benn and Tyler Seguin earned assists. Stars 2, Colorado 1 .
Stars : With the Stars on the power play, Eakin snapped in a wrister from the slot off a nice pass from Jason Demers at the 8:50 mark of the second period. Stars 3, Colorado 1 .
Colorado : With Colorado on the power play, Erik Johnson pounded a one-timer in from distance at the 14:53 mark of the second period. Stars 3, Colorado 2 .
Colorado : With Colorado on the power play, Jarome Iginla and Gabriel Landeskog worked a nice give-and-go with Iginla tapping in the goal at the 17:51 mark of the second period. Stars 3, Colorado 3 .
Colorado : Avalanche center John Mitchell dropped anchor in the slot, and when the puck trickled to him, he hammered it past Niemi at the 8:11 mark of the third period. Colorado 4, Stars 3 .
Colorado : Alex Tanguay made his second great pass of the game,finding GabrielLandeskogopen for a one-timer at the 8:58 of the thirdperiod. Colorado 5, Stars 3 .
Colorado : Landeskog walked in from the right circle and beat Niemi with 2:26 remaining in the third period. Colorado 6, Stars 3 .
